oai_dc:dc.dc:title: William Lauderdale's Captain commission
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Document commissioning William Lauderdale as Captain in the 15th regiment of the Tennessee militia. Signed by Willie Blount. Includes seal of the State of Tennessee. To all who shall see these presents, Greeting: Know ye, that reposing special trust and confidence in the patriotism, valor, conduct, and fidelity of William Lauderdale of the county of Sumner, we do commission him Captain in the 15th regiment of militia of this state …"

William Lauderdale ( - 1838) was a captain of the 15th Tennessee Regiment. He fought under Andrew Jackson in the War of 1812. Later, as a Major he played an important role in the overthrow of the Creek Indians.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Lauderdale, William, approximately 1780-1838;Jackson, Andrew, 1767-1845;Creek War, 1813-1814
War of 1812;Military
